alert.note: Alert for Boyd; Brown; Holt; Keya Paha; Rock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 3:27AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Rock, northeastern Brown, northwestern Holt, Keya Paha and western Boyd Counties through 430 AM CDT... At 326 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 16 miles southwest of Herrick to 10 miles southeast of Springview to 9 miles north of Ainsworth. Movement was southeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bassett, Springview, Atkinson, Stuart, Butte, Long Pine, Newport, Naper, Dustin, Burton, Anoka, Nets Peak, Sybrant, Meadville, Twin Lakes State Wildlife Management Area, Hull Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Keller Park State Recreation Area, Thomas Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Mariaville and Pony Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 163 and 182, and between mile markers 198 and 225. Highway 20 between mile markers 250 and 295. Highway 12 between mile markers 40 and 118. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Boyd; Brown; Holt; Keya Paha; Rock
